channel.title: Future of the Internet
channel.description:
I've been curiously thinking about the internet lately, and how far it's gone within the past 10+ years. Every so often I come across a site that hasn't been update in a matter of years, that still uses the same old static html with no good design features or advanced scripting. With that, where do you see the internet going in the next 10+ years? Old websites lay in the forgotten remains of times long ago, never to be looked upon again, taking up space that could be used for something else, something more useful. Right now isn't the worst of it yet. What will happen in 10 years, when the sites we are using at this very moment are quite possibly dead, and only visited by a few randoms? What about 20 years? 30? Just as landfills hold the trash of many years ago, the internet will follow in it's footsteps. So much of our lives are on the internet, will our children's lives be too? Will they look upon what we have said, and be amazed on how poor our technology was? Will they want to get rid of the sites we once loved, to make room for the sites they want? We, right now, are at a awkward age in technology. Many people of this world right now, were around years before PCs, iPads, etc, so what happens when our children are born into a world that is based around I.T.? Are sites that we use now, going to be deleted, or are they going to be preserved? I'm not even talking about the next 20 years now, what will it be like in 1,000 years, when literally EVERYTHING we have come to love on the internet, is absolutely gone? It's just utterly amazing to look back at websites and games from 2001, or even sooner, and see how terrible they were. You might even say they are a waste of space, or you might say they should be preserved for the next generations to wow over such technology. Everything now is digital. Back in the day, everything was mechanical. We don't study caveman computers, because they simply didn't have them, but what will the future generations do when we don't have any real footprints in the world, other than the information on the web and in the cloud? Yes, we will still leave large footprints on the world, but nowhere near as much as the people of the later generations did: generations that are still living today, but won't be in the near future?
TL;DR - I guess the point of this is, what do you see the internet looking like in the years to come? Do you see it as a wasteland of what it once was, or do you see a bright new future?

item.title: Future of the Internet
item.dc:creator: @Porygon Porygon
item.description:
@Porygon wrote:

The internet is just going to keep growing. But, does it have a limit? Any boundaries? Not that I have seen.

Read full topic

item.description:
@Tree wrote:

Where’s it going? Obama’s iPad.

Read full topic

item.title: Future of the Internet
item.dc:creator: @Kodiak Kodiak
item.description:
@Kodiak wrote:

Acorn_:

Probably have chips implanted into our brains and we’ll be able to see 3-D images through our mind and use our thoughts as the mouse o.o

this has already been made do-able through different laboratory tests

Read full topic

item.title: Future of the Internet
item.dc:creator: @Host_Gushers Host Gushers
item.description:
@Host_Gushers wrote:

i don’t think there will be a big difference in the internet. I know that Google is making blimps to give people who don’t have WiFi access to the internet. Otherwise nothing really…I think this topic should be changed to “Future of Electronics” so we have more to talk about.

Read full topic

item.title: Future of the Internet
item.dc:creator: @MrFun MrFun
item.description:
@MrFun wrote:

You know there is more then one Internet? But I think you want to know whats the future of what it will become? Well the internet is basically the holy grail of a perfect planetary communications and will only evolve enough on Earth until it reaches its end to upgrades, and will only need upgrades on communication lengths (exc) when we travel through space.

Read full topic

item.title: Future of the Internet
item.dc:creator: @_Vengeance _Vengeance
item.description:
@_Vengeance wrote:

Acorn_:

Probably have chips implanted into our brains and we’ll be able to see 3-D images through our mind and use our thoughts as the mouse o.o

I wrote a short essay/rant the other day. Here’s a line directly from it

”Sit down in your overdressed cave, and watch the world with all the comfort of Italian leather stuck to your skin. I hear it even comes in 3D now!”

The concept of looking at a 3D picture is fucking ridiculous to me. The world is already in 3D - if you want to experience that, remove your eyes from the screen in front of you and do something.

Read full topic

item.title: Future of the Internet
item.dc:creator: @The_Un-Named The Un-Named
item.description:
@The_Un-Named wrote:

[quote=“Bowser jr, post:13, topic:509114”][quote author=Niall link=topic=627358.msg4309384#msg4309384 date=1370484689]

In my opinion we’ll have blown the world up many times over by that time.

Is that a bad thing?

well I kinda like this world

but the world doesn’t like us ^^
[/quote]
I’ve always wondered when Great Britain will secede from the earth. I’ve considered asking http://what-if.xkcd.com/ about what it would be require to get it out in orbit around the earth.[/quote]

I’d personally love to secede from the earth, I’m just not sure I’d like to bring Great Britain along with me! Haha!

I’d live alone in the moon, burning up my fuel in outer space.

Read full topic

item.dc:creator: @Rodgerwilco Rodgerwilco
item.description:
@Rodgerwilco wrote:

Considering the internet hasn’t changed since the 1960s… the guy knew what he was doing.

I see kids looking up their parents, grandparents etc etc video. I saw that 1980 video of seven eleven… and I can only imagine.

item.title: Future of the Internet
item.dc:creator: @adeathsmckitten adeathsmckitten
item.description:
@adeathsmckitten wrote:

Things won’t change much. If anything, if they do start changing a lot, the government will start telling us what we can/cannot do on it.

Read full topic

item.title: Future of the Internet
item.dc:creator: @Slave_Scyth Slave Scyth
item.description:
@Slave_Scyth wrote:

You make it sound as if the internet is a physical area that can actually be filled. The only thing that could be “filled” is IP addresses, and with IPv6 we’ve got a long time to go before we run out of any of those.

Our children will see the same shitty sites that we view now and think the same thing we think when we see black and white, soundless movies.

Read full topic

item.title: Future of the Internet
item.dc:creator: @Fire_capez Fire capez
item.description:
@Fire_capez wrote:

This is purely speculation of course but I could personally see many countries trying some form of international regulation, and quite frankly I hope they do because the spread of information at this speed isn’t always a good thing.

Read full topic

item.title: Future of the Internet
item.dc:creator: @davidi2 Davidi2
item.description:
@davidi2 wrote:

‘The internet’ is too broad a term to make an accurate assumption of. It’s how we communicate, and I don’t think it will ever be removed, just improved upon. It’s like the movies. Been around for years, but we just keep improving them and making them better to fit the times. Will we be looking at projected screens right in front of our face or on glasses to browse the web instead of PC’s? Probably. But the internet I think will always be around in some form.

Read full topic
